description: Either back-formation from procrastination, or from Latin prōcrastinātum, past participle of prōcrastinō (“defer, put off till tomorrow”), from prō (“in favor of”) + crāstinus (“of or belonging to tomorrow”), from crās (“tomorrow”)

verbs.description: procrastinate (third-person singular simple present procrastinates, present participle procrastinating, simple past and past participle procrastinated)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To delay taking action; to wait until later.
examples: He procrastinated until the last minute and had to stay up all night to finish.
